security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate documentation and development guide skill for building MCP servers. The Python scripts (connections.py, evaluation.py) are development tools for testing user-created MCP servers. Network access is limited to Anthropic API and local MCP server connections. Environment variables are used securely for API key management. All capabilities align with the stated purpose.

content.user_title: Build MCP servers for LLM tool integration
content.value_statement: This guide helps developers create high-quality MCP servers that enable AI models to interact with external APIs and services. Covers Python FastMCP and TypeScript SDK patterns with best practices for tool design.
actual_capabilities: Guides MCP server project setup for Python and TypeScript
Provides tool implementation patterns with Pydantic and Zod validation
Includes evaluation framework for testing MCP server effectiveness
Documents MCP protocol specification and transport mechanisms
Covers best practices for tool naming, pagination, and error handling
limitations: Does not execute user code - provides guidance only
Does not access external APIs directly - documents integration patterns
Requires users to implement their own MCP server code
Evaluation scripts require Anthropic API key for testing

use_cases.title: Integrate external APIs
use_cases.description: Build MCP servers that expose external APIs as tools for AI models to use in tasks.

use_cases.title: Standardize LLM tool interfaces
use_cases.description: Create consistent, well-documented MCP servers for internal services and APIs.

use_cases.title: Test MCP server quality
use_cases.description: Use evaluation framework to assess whether AI models can effectively use your MCP server.

prompt_templates.title: Create MCP Server
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an MCP server for [SERVICE_NAME] API. Use [Python/TypeScript]. The API has endpoints for [LIST KEY OPERATIONS].

prompt_templates.title: Add New Tool
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new tool called [TOOL_NAME] to my existing [LANGUAGE] MCP server. It should [DESCRIPTION OF FUNCTIONALITY].

prompt_templates.title: Improve Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my MCP server tools and improve the descriptions for clarity. Current tools: [LIST TOOLS].

prompt_templates.title: Create Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create 10 evaluation questions for my [SERVICE] MCP server that test whether AI models can answer complex questions using the available tools.

output_examples.input: Create an MCP server for GitHub integration using Python FastMCP
output: Project structure with src/tools/ and src/services/ directories
Tool implementation with @mcp.tool decorator and Pydantic models

output_examples.input: Build a TypeScript MCP server for Slack with proper error handling
output: McpServer initialization with version and name
Zod schemas for input validation with descriptions
Error handling with actionable error messages
Transport configuration for stdio or HTTP

output_examples.input: Create evaluation questions for my JIRA MCP server
output: Question: Find all high-priority bugs created last month with no assignee
Question: Count open issues by label in project [NAME]
Question: Identify the most active reviewers in Q4 2024

best_practices: Use descriptive tool names with service prefixes like github_create_issue to avoid conflicts
Implement pagination with limit parameters to avoid overwhelming AI context windows
Return both structured JSON data and human-readable Markdown responses
anti_patterns: Avoid generic tool names like get_data that lack service context
Do not return excessive data without pagination or filtering options
Avoid vague error messages that do not suggest next steps

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Python FastMCP and TypeScript MCP SDK are fully documented. Other languages may work but lack guidance.

faq.question: Do I need an API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: No API key is needed to read the guides. Testing MCP servers with the evaluation script requires an Anthropic API key.

faq.question: Can I use this to build production MCP servers?
faq.answer: Yes, the guides cover production-ready patterns including error handling, pagination, and authentication.

faq.question: How are tools authenticated?
faq.answer: The documentation covers using environment variables for API keys in server implementations.

faq.question: What transport methods are supported?
faq.answer: stdio for local servers, Streamable HTTP for remote servers. SSE is documented but not recommended.

faq.question: How do I test if my MCP server works well?
faq.answer: Use the evaluation framework to create test questions that verify AI models can effectively use your tools.
